internet traffic via an encrypted

nodes and the last node before that
final server is called the tour exit
node now all the traffic up until the
communication between the tour exit node
and the final server is all encrypted
it's only decrypted at the end
point and secondly the server only sees

node it does not see the IP address of
the client itself thereby providing for
anonymity now if later on the client
wants to connect to a different server

route through the tour nodes to reach

okay that said let's see how it
works tortilla consists of two
components the tortilla client which
runs in user mode on The Host Windows
system and the adapter which runs in
kernel
mode networked applications are run in a
virtual machine so that malicious code
can circumvent the Tor tunnel to the
internet and can't discover identifying
information on the host
system and because of the design of
tortilla we can use any virtual machine
platform we want whether it be VMware
hyperv virtual box virtual PC Etc and we
could use any operating system in the
guest virtual Machinery wants chances
are a user using tortilla would be using
Windows in their guest as well but they
could use Linux instead or what have
you when you install tortilla it creates
a virtual network
adapter uh and disables all Network
component bindings except for that of
the virtual tour network bridge um now
this
guarantees that other network
applications on the host system won't be
able to interfere with the dat being

2 Network traffic from the vm's virtual
network
card and contains a DHCP server and R
responder uh very basic ones and these

get an IP address uh it also comes with
a DNS server the tortilla DNS server
watches for DNS requests from the
virtual
machine repackages them as requests over
tour and asks the tour exit node to do
the DNS resolution
for the client and the tortilla client
receives the response from tour and
repackages it as a DNS response sends it
back to the virtual machine totally
transparently to the network application
in the virtual machine and the tortilla
client also makes use of the open source
lightweight IP stack for proing TCP
sessions between the virtual machine and
tour and you'll notice that through the
entire architecture here no packets from
the virtual machine ever touch the
host's actual Network driver only thing
touching the network driver is tour

the given virtual machine
platform uh once everything's set up the
